newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Seardel talks progressing, warns on H2.
newsitem.headline: Seardel talks progressing, warns on H2.

text.p: Seardel Investment Corp Ltd, a South African investment holding company, said on Thursday that its chairman Aaron Searl and a consortium of senior management were still considering plans to acquire all the investments owned by Seardel.
The move could result in Seardel becoming a cash shell company or being delisted.

"(Seardel shareholders) are advised that investigations into the possible management buyout...are still in progress," the firm said in a statement advising its shareholders to exercise caution when dealing in its shares.
The firm also warned that some of its performance estimates published with its interim figures in February had been hit by tougher than expected trading.
"These, with the exception of the turnover figure, will not be achieved due to the difficult trading conditions at retail level during the second half of the financial year," the firm said.
